alert.note: Alert for Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Lawrence; Vinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:34PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Meigs, northwestern Gallia, Jackson, Vinton, western Athens and northwestern Lawrence Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Piketon, or near Waverly, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Athens, Jackson, Wellston, Nelsonville, Glouster, Mcarthur, Oak Hill, Rio Grande, Albany, Lake Hope State Park, Gallia, Vernon, Chauncey, Hamden, Buchtel, Jacksonville, Coalton, Murray City, Trimble, and Zaleski. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Ohio.
